intro: Cracca greenmanii, commonly known as the greenman's cracca, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Cracca greenmanii is also valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens due to its delicate appearance.
